signals.title: ILO: Global Jobs Gap Reaches 408 Million in 2026 Despite Stable Unemployment

content.abstract: ILO Employment and Social Trends 2026 report reveals global jobs gap (people wanting paid work but unable to access it) projected at 408 million. Official unemployment at 4.9% (186M) masks structural exclusion: 300M in extreme poverty, 2.1B in informal employment. Women 24.2% less likely to participate in labor force. 260M youth (20%) not in employment, education, or training. Employment growth diverging by income level: 0.5% in upper-middle vs 3.1% in low-income countries.

signals.classification_reasoning: ILO flagship report on global employment and social trends directly addresses demographic, labor, and social inequality issues -- core Social domain.

signals.title: Climate Models Missing Key Ocean Player: Plankton Shallow Dissolution Underestimated

content.abstract: Marine plankton building calcium carbonate shells play outsized role in regulating Earth's climate, but largely missing from climate models. Much calcium carbonate produced by plankton does not sink to ocean floor but dissolves in upper ocean ('shallow dissolution'). This process is underrepresented in climate forecasting models, potentially skewing carbon cycle projections.

signals.classification_reasoning: Climate modeling gap involving marine biology -- Environmental domain. Scientific finding with implications for climate prediction accuracy.

signals.title: FDA Clears First Human Trial of Epigenetic Reprogramming Anti-Aging Therapy

content.abstract: FDA approved first-ever human clinical trial of epigenetic reprogramming therapy (Life Biosciences' ER-100). Uses three Yamanaka factors (OSK) to reset age-associated epigenetic markers while preserving cell identity. Targets age-related eye diseases (glaucoma, NAION). Excludes c-Myc to lower tumor risk. Cofounded by Harvard's David Sinclair. Phase 1 enrollment starting Feb 2026. Historic milestone: first translation of partial cellular rejuvenation from lab to human patients.

signals.classification_reasoning: Biotechnology breakthrough -- first human trial of anti-aging gene therapy. Technological domain with spiritual/ethical implications.

signals.title: Deep-Sea Chiton Named by Public Vote: 8,000 Submissions for Rare Species

content.abstract: Newly identified deep-sea chiton named Ferreiraella populi through public naming competition with 8,000+ submissions. Campaign began after science YouTuber Ze Frank featured the rare creature. Represents growing citizen science engagement and public interest in deep-sea biodiversity, coinciding with debates over seabed mining in the Clarion-Clipperton Zone.

signals.classification_reasoning: Citizen science and public engagement in biodiversity -- Social domain (cultural, educational dimension of science-society relationship).

signals.title: NASA Perseverance Achieves AI-Driven Autonomous Navigation: 450m Without Human Input

content.abstract: NASA used AI to generate waypoints for Perseverance rover's route on two separate days, with the rover driving over 450 meters autonomously without human input. Represents significant step toward greater autonomy for planetary exploration rovers, reducing Earth-to-Mars communication delays from decision-making loop.

signals.classification_reasoning: AI-driven autonomous space exploration technology -- Technological domain combining AI and space exploration frontiers.

signals.title: Longevity Research Paradigm Shift: From 'Fixing Damage' to 'Preserving System Harmony'

content.abstract: Scientists rethinking longevity goals for 2026: aging viewed not as damage accumulation but as progressive decline in coordinated function of complex biological systems. Paradigm shift from reductionist 'fix the defect' to systems-level 'preserve harmony' approach. Growing consensus that cellular, metabolic, and microbial network dialogue is critical to aging process. Multi-target interventions (inflammation, metabolism, senescence, mitochondrial function) outperform single-pathway approaches.

signals.classification_reasoning: Paradigm shift in understanding aging -- touches on values, meaning, and the philosophical question of what aging 'is'. Spiritual/values domain (how we conceptualize human mortality and intervention).
